current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To require certain agencies to conduct assessments of data centers and develop data center consolidation and optimization plans.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: Federal Data Center Consolidation Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator for the Office of E-Government and Information Technology
		within the Office of Management and Budget
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Administrator for the Office of E-Government and Information Technology

term.#tail:
means the Federal Data Center Consolidation Initiative
		described in the Office of Management and Budget Memorandum on the Federal Data
		Center Consolidation Initiative, dated February 26, 2010, or any successor
		thereto.

header.#text:
Federal data
		center consolidation inventories and strategies

text.#text:

		comprehensive asset inventory of the data centers owned, operated, or

		a third party; and

a

		data center assets, that includes—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

		enactment of this Act, which shall include a breakdown on a year-by-year basis
		of the projected savings.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Data Center Consolidation Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:4/sp:A

text.#text:
An agency required
		to implement a data center consolidation plan under this Act and migrate to
		cloud computing shall do so in a manner that is consistent with Federal
		guidelines on cloud computing security, including—

header.#text:
Ensuring
		cybersecurity standards for data center consolidation and cloud
		computing

text.#text:
applicable
		provisions found within the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program
		(FedRAMP); and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Institute of Standards and Technology

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may waive the requirements of this Act for any element
		(or component of an element) of the intelligence community.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Director of National Intelligence

text.#text:
This Act is repealed effective on
		October 1, 2018.
